017package org.microbean.path;
018
019import java.lang.StackWalker.StackFrame;
020
021import java.lang.constant.ClassDesc;
022import java.lang.constant.Constable;
023import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
024import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
025import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
026import java.lang.constant.MethodTypeDesc;
027
028import java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType;
029import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
030import java.lang.reflect.Type;
031
032import java.util.ArrayList;
033import java.util.Arrays;
034import java.util.Collection;
035import java.util.Collections;
036import java.util.Iterator;
037import java.util.List;
038import java.util.Map;
039import java.util.Objects;
040import java.util.Optional;
041import java.util.Spliterator;

046import java.util.stream.Stream;

048import org.microbean.constant.Constables;

050import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;

052import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualified;
053import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
054
055import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
056import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_List;
057import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_Object;
058import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_String;
059import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_boolean;
060import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.DEFAULT_NAME;
061import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.FALSE;
062import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.NULL;
063import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.TRUE;
064
065import static java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc.Kind.STATIC;
066
067import static org.microbean.path.ConstantDescs.CD_Path;
068import static org.microbean.path.ConstantDescs.CD_PathElement;
069
070import static org.microbean.qualifier.ConstantDescs.CD_Qualifiers;
071
072/**
073 * A {@linkplain Qualified qualified} sequence of {@linkplain
074 * Path.Element named and qualified elements} that "points to" an
075 * object and that can be used for many different purposes.
076 *
077 * <p>A {@link Path} can be used like a {@link javax.naming.Name
078 * javax.naming.Name}, or like a {@link java.nio.file.Path
079 * java.nio.file.Path}, or like a {@link java.net.URI java.net.URI}.
080 * It differs from these other objects in that it combines some of
081 * their concepts together.</p>
082 *
083 * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}; most notably
084 * <strong>not necessarily</strong> the type of the thing the {@link
085 * Path} "points to"; more like an additional qualifier
086 *
087 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
088 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
089 *
090 * @see Path.Element
091 */
092public final class Path<T> implements Iterable<Path.Element<?>>, Qualified<String, Object, T> {
093
094
095  /*
096   * Static fields.
097   */
098
099
100  private static final StackWalker stackWalker = StackWalker.getInstance();
101
102  private static final Path<?> ROOT = new Path<>();
103
104  private static final char PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR = '.';
105
106  private static final String PREFIX_SEPARATOR = "" + PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR;
107
108
109  /*
110   * Instance fields.
111   */
112
113
114  private final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers;
115
116  private final List<Element<?>> elements;
117
118  private final boolean transliterated;
119
120
121  /*
122   * Constructors.
123   */
124
125
126  // For use by ROOT only.
127  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
128  private Path() {
129    this(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), (Element<T>)Element.root(), true);
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Creates a new {@link Path}.
134   *
135   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement last element} of
136   * this {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
137   *
138   * @exception NullPointerException if any parameter is {@code null}
139   *
140   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
141   */
142  public Path(final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
143    this(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), lastElement, false);
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Creates a new {@link Path}.
148   *
149   * @param qualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers()
150   * qualifiers}; must not be {@code null}
151   *
152   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement last element} of
153   * this {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
154   *
155   * @exception NullPointerException if any parameter is {@code null}
156   *
157   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
158   */
159  public Path(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
160              final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
161    this(qualifiers, List.of(), lastElement, false);
162  }
163
164  /**
165   * Creates a new {@link Path}.
166   *
167   * @param qualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers()
168   * qualifiers}; must not be {@code null}
169   *
170   * @param elements the {@linkplain Element elements} of this {@link
171   * Path}; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
172   * List#isEmpty() empty}
173   *
174   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement last element} of
175   * this {@link Path}; must not be {@code null}
176   *
177   * @exception NullPointerException if any parameter is {@code null}
178   */
179  public Path(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
180              final List<? extends Element<?>> elements,
181              final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
182    this(qualifiers, elements, lastElement, false);
183  }
184
185  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
186  private Path(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
187               final List<? extends Element<?>> elements,
188               final Element<? extends T> lastElement,
189               final boolean transliterated) {
190    super();
191    final int size = elements.size();
192    if (size > 0) {
193      Map<String, Object> pathQualifiers = null;
194      final List<Element<?>> newList = new ArrayList<>(size + 1);
195      StringBuilder prefix = null;
196      for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
197        final Element<?> e = elements.get(i);
198        newList.add(e);
199        final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> eQualifiers = e.qualifiers();
200        if (!eQualifiers.isEmpty()) {
201          if (prefix == null) {
202            prefix = new StringBuilder();
203          }
204          if (pathQualifiers == null) {
205            pathQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(qualifiers.toMap());
206          }
207          prefix.append(e.name()).append(PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR);
208          final String finalPrefix = prefix.toString();
209          pathQualifiers.putAll(((Qualifiers<String, Object>)eQualifiers).withPrefix(k -> finalPrefix + PREFIX_SEPARATOR + k).toMap());
210        }
211      }
212      newList.add(lastElement);
213      this.elements = Collections.unmodifiableList(newList);
214      final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> lastElementQualifiers = lastElement.qualifiers();
215      if (lastElementQualifiers.isEmpty()) {
216        if (pathQualifiers == null) {
217          this.qualifiers = (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
218        } else {
219          this.qualifiers = new Qualifiers<>(pathQualifiers);
220        }
221      } else {
222        if (prefix == null) {
223          prefix = new StringBuilder();
224        }
225        if (pathQualifiers == null) {
226          pathQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(qualifiers.toMap());
227        }
228        final String finalPrefix = prefix.append(lastElement.name()).toString();
229        pathQualifiers.putAll(lastElement.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> finalPrefix + PREFIX_SEPARATOR + k).toMap());
230        this.qualifiers = new Qualifiers<>(pathQualifiers);
231      }
232    } else {
233      this.elements = List.of(lastElement);
234      final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> lastElementQualifiers = lastElement.qualifiers();
235      if (lastElementQualifiers.isEmpty()) {
236        this.qualifiers = (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
237      } else {
238        final Map<String, Object> pathQualifiers = new TreeMap<>(qualifiers.toMap());
239        pathQualifiers.putAll(lastElement.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> lastElement.name() + PREFIX_SEPARATOR + k).toMap());
240        this.qualifiers = new Qualifiers<>(pathQualifiers);
241      }
242    }
243    this.transliterated = transliterated;
244  }
245
246
247  /*
248   * Instance methods.
249   */
250
251
252  /**
253   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Path} is the
254   * result of a call to {@link #transliterate(BiFunction)}.
255   *
256   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} is {@linkplain
257   * #transliterate(BiFunction) transliterated}; {@code false}
258   * otherwise
259   */
260  public final boolean transliterated() {
261    return this.transliterated;
262  }
263
264  /**
265   * <em>Transliterates</em> this {@link Path} into another,
266   * semantically equivalent {@link Path} by applying the supplied
267   * {@link BiFunction}, and returns the transliterated {@link Path}.
268   *
269   * <p>The supplied {@link BiFunction} accepts a Java package name as
270   * its first argument, which will be the first package name
271   * {@linkplain StackWalker encountered in the current thread's
272   * stack} that identifies a caller whose package name is not equal
273   * to {@link Class#getPackageName() Path.class.getPackageName()}.
274   * Its second argument is a {@link Element Element} from this
275   * {@link Path}.  It must return a {@link Element} representing the
276   * transliteration of its second argument (which may be the second
277   * argument itself).</p>
278   *
279   * <p>Transliteration can be needed when a {@link Path} is defined
280   * by a Java class and used by an application containing that Java
281   * class&mdash;because another Java class may have used the same
282   * element names to refer to different things.</p>
283   *
284   * <p>If this {@link Path} {@linkplain #transliterated() is
285   * already transliterated} then it is returned.</p>
286   *
287   * @param f a {@link BiFunction} responsible for the
288   * transliteration, element by element; may be {@code null}
289   *
290   * @return the transliterated {@link Path}, which may be this {@link
291   * Path}; never {@code null}
292   *
293   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
294   *
295   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic, but the
296   * supplied {@link BiFunction} may not be.
297   *
298   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
299   * threads, but the supplied {@link BiFunction} may not be.
300   *
301   * @see #transliterated()
302   */
303  @Experimental
304  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
305  public final Path<T> transliterate(final BiFunction<? super String, ? super Element<?>, ? extends Element<?>> f) {
306    if (this.transliterated()) {
307      return this;
308    } else {
309      final int size = this.size();
310      final int lastIndex = size - 1;
311      if (f == null) {
312        return
313          new Path<T>(this.qualifiers(),
314                      this.elements.subList(0, lastIndex),
315                      (Element<? extends T>)this.elements.get(lastIndex),
316                      true);
317      } else {
318        final String userPackageName = stackWalker.walk(Path::findUserPackageName);
319        final List<Element<?>> newElements = new ArrayList<>(lastIndex);
320        for (int i = 0; i < lastIndex; i++) {
321          newElements.add(f.apply(userPackageName, this.elements.get(i)));
322        }
323        return
324          new Path<T>(this.qualifiers(),
325                      newElements,
326                      (Element<? extends T>)f.apply(userPackageName, this.elements.get(lastIndex)),
327                      true);
328      }
329    }
330  }
331
332  /**
333   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
334   * representing this {@link Path}, or an {@linkplain
335   * Optional#isEmpty() empty <code>Optional</code>} if this {@link
336   * Path} cannot be represented as a {@link ConstantDesc}.
337   *
338   * <p>A {@link Path} instance may be represented by a {@link
339   * ConstantDesc} only when the return value of an invocation of the
340   * {@link Element#describeConstable()} method on its {@linkplain
341   * #lastElement() last element} returns a non-{@linkplain
342   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional}.</p>
343   *
344   * @return an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
345   * representing this {@link Path}; never {@code null}; possibly
346   * {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty}
347   *
348   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
349   *
350   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
351   *
352   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
353   * threads.
354   *
355   * @see Element#describeConstable()
356   */
357  @Override // Constable
358  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
359    if (this.isRoot()) {
360      return
361        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
362                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
363                                                CD_Path,
364                                                MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
365                                                                          CD_Path,
366                                                                          "root",
367                                                                          MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_Path))));
368    } else {
369      final ConstantDesc qualifiers = this.qualifiers().describeConstable().orElse(null);
370      if (qualifiers != null) {
371        final ConstantDesc elements = Constables.describeConstable(this.elements.subList(0, this.size() - 1)).orElse(null);
372        if (elements != null) {
373          final ConstantDesc lastElement = this.elements.get(this.size() - 1).describeConstable().orElse(null);
374          if (lastElement != null) {
375            return
376              Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
377                                                      DEFAULT_NAME,
378                                                      CD_Path,
379                                                      MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_Path,
380                                                                                     CD_Qualifiers,
381                                                                                     CD_List,
382                                                                                     CD_PathElement,
383                                                                                     CD_boolean),
384                                                      qualifiers,
385                                                      elements,
386                                                      lastElement,
387                                                      this.transliterated ? TRUE : FALSE));
388          }
389        }
390      }
391    }
392    return Optional.empty();
393  }
394
395  /**
396   * Returns the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link Path}.
397   *
398   * @return the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link Path}
399   *
400   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
401   *
402   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
403   *
404   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
405   * threads.
406   */
407  @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
408  public final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers() {
409    return this.qualifiers;
410  }
411
412  /**
413   * Returns an {@link Iterator} that iterates over the {@linkplain
414   * Element elements} of this {@link Path}, including the {@linkplain
415   * #lastElement() last element}.
416   *
417   * @return an {@link Iterator} that iterates over the {@linkplain
418   * Element elements} of this {@link Path}, including the {@linkplain
419   * #lastElement() last element}
420   *
421   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
422   *
423   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
424   *
425   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
426   * threads.
427   */
428  @Override // Iterable<Element<?>>
429  public final Iterator<Element<?>> iterator() {
430    return this.elements.iterator();
431  }
432
433  /**
434   * Returns a {@link Spliterator} for the {@linkplain Element
435   * elements} of this {@link Path}, including the {@linkplain
436   * #lastElement() last element}.
437   *
438   * @return a {@link Spliterator} for the {@linkplain Element
439   * elements} of this {@link Path}, including the {@linkplain
440   * #lastElement() last element}
441   *
442   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
443   *
444   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
445   *
446   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
447   * threads.
448   */
449  @Override // Iterable<Element<?>>
450  public final Spliterator<Element<?>> spliterator() {
451    return this.elements.spliterator();
452  }
453
454  /**
455   * Returns a {@link Stream} of this {@link Path}'s {@link Element}s.
456   *
457   * @return a possibly parallel {@link Stream} of this {@link Path}'s
458   * {@link Element}s
459   *
460   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
461   *
462   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
463   *
464   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
465   * threads.
466   */
467  public final Stream<Element<?>> stream() {
468    return this.elements.stream();
469  }
470
471  /**
472   * Returns a possibly parallel {@link Stream} of this {@link Path}'s
473   * {@link Element}s.
474   *
475   * @return a possibly parallel {@link Stream} of this {@link Path}'s
476   * {@link Element}s
477   *
478   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
479   *
480   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
481   *
482   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
483   * threads.
484   */
485  public final Stream<Element<?>> parallelStream() {
486    return this.elements.parallelStream();
487  }
488
489  /**
490   * Returns the number of {@link Element}s in this {@link Path},
491   * which is always greater than or equal to {@code 1}.
492   *
493   * @return the number of {@link Element}s in this {@link Path}
494   *
495   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
496   *
497   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
498   * threads.
499   */
500  public final int size() {
501    return this.elements.size();
502  }
503
504  /**
505   * Returns the last {@link Element} in this {@link Path}.
506   *
507   * @return the last {@link Element} in this {@link Path}
508   *
509   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
510   *
511   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
512   *
513   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
514   * threads.
515   */
516  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
517  public final Element<T> lastElement() {
518    return (Element<T>)this.elements.get(this.size() - 1);
519  }
520
521  /**
522   * Calls the {@link Element#qualified()} method on the {@linkplain
523   * lastElement() last element in this <code>Path</code>} and returns
524   * the result.
525   *
526   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Element#qualified()}
527   * method on the {@linkplain lastElement() last element in this
528   * <code>Path</code>}
529   *
530   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
531   *
532   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
533   *
534   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
535   * threads.
536   */
537  @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
538  public final T qualified() {
539    return this.lastElement().qualified();
540  }
541
542  /**
543   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Path} is a <em>root
544   * path</em>, which is true when it has only one {@linkplain Element
545   * element} and that {@linkplain Element element} {@linkplain
546   * Element#isRoot() is root}.
547   *
548   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Path} is a <em>root
549   * path</em>; {@code false} otherwise
550   *
551   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
552   *
553   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
554   * threads.
555   */
556  public final boolean isRoot() {
557    return this.size() == 1 && this.lastElement().isRoot();
558  }
559
560  /**
561   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Path} is
562   * <em>absolute</em>, which means that its first {@link Element} is
563   * a {@linkplain Element#isRoot() root} {@link Element}.
564   *
565   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Path} is absolute
566   */
567  public final boolean absolute() {
568    return this.elements.get(0).isRoot();
569  }
570
571  /**
572   * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Path}.
573   *
574   * @return a hashcode for this {@link Path}
575   *
576   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
577   *
578   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
579   * threads.
580   */
581  @Override // Object
582  public final int hashCode() {
583    int hashCode = 17;
584    Object value = this.qualifiers();
585    int c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
586    hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
587    value = this.elements;
588    c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
589    hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
590    c = this.transliterated ? 1 : 0;
591    hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
592    return hashCode;
593  }
594
595  /**
596   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Object}
597   * is equal to this {@link Path}.
598   *
599   * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
600   * which case {@code false} will be returned
601   *
602   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Object}
603   * is equal to this {@link Path}
604   *
605   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
606   *
607   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
608   * threads.
609   */
610  @Override // Object
611  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
612    if (other == this) {
613      return true;
614    } else if (other != null && other.getClass() == this.getClass()) {
615      final Path<?> her = (Path<?>)other;
616      return
617        Objects.equals(this.qualifiers(), her.qualifiers()) &&
618        Objects.equals(this.elements, her.elements) &&
619        this.transliterated == her.transliterated;
620    } else {
621      return false;
622    }
623  }
624
625  /**
626   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
627   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} and
628   * {@linkplain Element elments} plus the supplied {@linkplain
629   * Element element}.
630   *
631   * @param <U> the type of the new {@link Path}
632   *
633   * @param element the new {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #lastElement()
634   * last element}; must not be {@code null}
635   *
636   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
637   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} and
638   * {@linkplain Element elments} plus the supplied {@linkplain
639   * Element element}
640   *
641   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code element} is {@code
642   * null}
643   *
644   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
645   *
646   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
647   *
648   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
649   * threads.
650   */
651  public final <U> Path<U> plus(final Element<? extends U> element) {
652    return new Path<>(this.qualifiers(), this.elements, element);
653  }
654
655  /**
656   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
657   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link
658   * Path}'s elements, the supplied {@code elements}, and the supplied
659   * {@code lastElement}.
660   *
661   * @param <U> the type of the new {@link Path}
662   *
663   * @param elements additional {@linkplain Element elements}; must
664   * not be {@code null}
665   *
666   * @param lastElement the new {@link Path}'s {@linkplain
667   * #lastElement() last element}; must not be {@code null}
668   *
669   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
670   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link
671   * Path}'s elements, the supplied {@code elements}, and the supplied
672   * {@code lastElement}
673   *
674   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code element} is {@code
675   * null}
676   *
677   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
678   *
679   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
680   *
681   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
682   * threads.
683   */
684  public final <U> Path<U> plus(final Collection<? extends Element<?>> elements,
685                                final Element<? extends U> lastElement) {
686    final List<Element<?>> newElements = new ArrayList<>(this.size() + elements.size());
687    newElements.addAll(elements);
688    return new Path<>(this.qualifiers(), newElements, lastElement);
689  }
690
691  /**
692   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
693   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} combined
694   * with a prefixed version of the supplied {@link Path}'s
695   * {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link Path}'s
696   * elements, the supplied {@link Path}'s elements, and the supplied
697   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #lastElement() last element}.
698   *
699   * <p>The new {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}
700   * are those of this {@link Path} plus those of the supplied {@link
701   * Path}, where each qualifier in the supplied {@link Path}'s
702   * {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} has been prefixed with a
703   * {@link String} formed from the {@linkplain Element#name() names}
704   * of all the {@linkplain Element elements} in this {@link
705   * Path}.</p>
706   *
707   * @param <U> the type of the new {@link Path}
708   *
709   * @param path the {@link Path} to logically append; must not be
710   * {@code null}
711   *
712   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Path} consisting of this
713   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers} combined
714   * with a prefixed version of the supplied {@link Path}'s
715   * {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}, this {@link Path}'s
716   * elements, the supplied {@link Path}'s elements, and the supplied
717   * {@link Path}'s {@linkplain #lastElement() last element}
718   *
719   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
720   *
721   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
722   *
723   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
724   *
725   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
726   * threads.
727   */
728  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
729  public final <U> Path<U> plus(final Path<? extends U> path) {
730    final int pathSize = path.size();
731    final List<Element<?>> newElements = new ArrayList<>(this.size() + pathSize);
732    newElements.addAll(this.elements);
733    final int lastIndex = pathSize - 1;
734    for (int i = 0; i < lastIndex; i++) {
735      newElements.add(path.elements.get(i));
736    }
737    final String prefix = this.prefix();
738    return
739      new Path<>(path.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> prefix + k),
740                 newElements,
741                 (Element<? extends U>)path.elements.get(lastIndex));
742  }
743
744  private final String prefix() {
745    final StringBuilder prefix = new StringBuilder();
746    for (final Element<?> e : this) {
747      prefix.append(e.name()).append(PREFIX_SEPARATOR_CHAR);
748    }
749    return prefix.toString();
750  }
751

754   * Static methods.
755   */

758  /**
759   * Returns a {@link Path} that {@linkplain #isRoot() is a <em>root
760   * path</em>}.
761   *
762   * @return a {@link Path} that {@linkplain #isRoot() is a <em>root
763   * path</em>}
764   *
765   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
766   *
767   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
768   *
769   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
770   * threads.
771   *
772   * @see #isRoot()
773   */
774  public static final Path<?> root() {
775    return ROOT;
776  }
777
778  /**
779   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
780   * an {@link Element} formed from the supplied {@code qualified} and
781   * an {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty} {@linkplain Element#name()
782   * name}.
783   *
784   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
785   *
786   * @param qualified the {@linkplain Element#qualified() qualified
787   * item} of what will be the last {@link Element}
788   *
789   * @return a {@link Path}
790   *
791   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
792   * null}
793   *
794   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
795   *
796   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
797   *
798   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
799   * threads.
800   *
801   * @see #of(Object, List)
802   */
803  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final T qualified) {
804    return Path.of(qualified, List.of());
805  }
806
807  /**
808   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
809   * an {@link Element} formed from the supplied {@code qualified} and
810   * the supplied name.
811   *
812   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
813   *
814   * @param qualified the {@linkplain Element#qualified() qualified
815   * item} of what will be the last {@link Element}
816   *
817   * @param name the {@linkplain Element#name() name} of what will be
818   * the last {@link Element}
819   *
820   * @return a {@link Path}
821   *
822   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
823   *
824   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
825   * {@code null} and name is {@code null} or an empty
826   * <code>String</code>}
827   *
828   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
829   *
830   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
831   *
832   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
833   * threads.
834   *
835   * @see #of(Object, List)
836   */
837  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final T qualified, final String name) {
838    return Path.of(qualified, List.of(name));
839  }
840
841  /**
842   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
843   * {@link Element}s formed from the supplied {@code qualified} and
844   * the supplied array of {@linkplain Element#name() names}.
845   *
846   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
847   *
848   * @param qualified the {@linkplain Element#qualified() qualified
849   * item} of what will be the last {@link Element}
850   *
851   * @param names an array of {@linkplain Element#name() names} from
852   * which {@link Element}s will be synthesized; must not be {@code
853   * null}
854   *
855   * @return a {@link Path}
856   *
857   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code names} is {@code null}
858   *
859   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
860   * {@code null} and the last element of {@code names} {@linkplain
861   * String#isEmpty() is an empty <code>String</code>}
862   *
863   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
864   *
865   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
866   *
867   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
868   * threads.
869   *
870   * @see #of(Object, List)
871   */
872  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final T qualified, final String... names) {
873    return Path.of(qualified, Arrays.asList(names));
874  }
875
876  /**
877   * Returns a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
878   * {@link Element}s formed from the supplied {@code qualified} and
879   * the supplied {@link List} of {@linkplain Element#name() names}.
880   *
881   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
882   *
883   * @param qualified the {@linkplain Element#qualified() qualified
884   * item} of what will be the last {@link Element}
885   *
886   * @param names a {@link List} of {@linkplain Element#name() names}
887   * from which {@link Element}s will be synthesized; must not be
888   * {@code null}
889   *
890   * @return a {@link Path}
891   *
892   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code names} is {@code null}
893   *
894   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
895   * {@code null} and the last element of {@code names} {@linkplain
896   * String#isEmpty() is an empty <code>String</code>}
897   *
898   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
899   *
900   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
901   *
902   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
903   * threads.
904   *
905   * @see Element#Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
906   */
907  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final T qualified, final List<? extends String> names) {
908    final int lastIndex = names.size() - 1;
909    final List<Element<Object>> elements;
910    switch (lastIndex) {
911    case -1:
912      return new Path<>(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), Element.of(qualified, null));
913    case 0:
914      return new Path<>(Qualifiers.of(), List.of(), Element.of(qualified, names.get(0)));
915    default:
916      elements = new ArrayList<>(lastIndex);
917      for (int i = 0; i < lastIndex; i++) {
918        final String name = names.get(i);
919        elements.add(Element.of(name));
920      }
921      return new Path<>(Qualifiers.of(), elements, Element.of(qualified, names.get(lastIndex)));
922    }
923  }
924
925  /**
926   * Return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
927   * the supplied arguments and returns it.
928   *
929   * @param <T> the type of the {@link Path}
930   *
931   * @param pathQualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@link Qualifiers}; must
932   * not be {@code null}
933   *
934   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement() last
935   * <code>Element</code>} of the {@link Path}; must not be {@code
936   * null}
937   *
938   * @return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path}
939   *
940   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
941   *
942   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
943   *
944   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
945   *
946   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
947   * threads.
948   *
949   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
950   */
951  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> pathQualifiers,
952                                     final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
953    return new Path<>(pathQualifiers, lastElement);
954  }
955
956  /**
957   * Return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path} formed from
958   * the supplied arguments and returns it.
959   *
960   * @param <T> the type of the new {@link Path}
961   *
962   * @param pathQualifiers the {@link Path}'s {@link Qualifiers}; must
963   * not be {@code null}
964   *
965   * @param elements the interior {@link Element}s of the {@link
966   * Path}; must not be {@code null}
967   *
968   * @param lastElement the {@linkplain #lastElement() last
969   * <code>Element</code>} of the {@link Path}; must not be {@code
970   * null}
971   *
972   * @return a (<strong>usually new</strong>) {@link Path}
973   *
974   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
975   *
976   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
977   *
978   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
979   *
980   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
981   * threads.
982   *
983   * @see #Path(Qualifiers, List, Element)
984   */
985  public static final <T> Path<T> of(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> pathQualifiers,
986                                     final List<? extends Element<?>> elements,
987                                     final Element<? extends T> lastElement) {
988    return new Path<>(pathQualifiers, elements, lastElement);
989  }
990
991  private static final String findUserPackageName(final Stream<StackFrame> stream) {
992    final String className = stream.sequential()
993      .dropWhile(f -> f.getClassName().startsWith(Path.class.getPackageName()))
994      .dropWhile(f -> f.getClassName().contains(".$Proxy")) // skip JDK proxies (and any other kind of proxies)
995      .map(StackFrame::getClassName)
996      .findFirst()
997      .orElse(null);
998    if (className == null) {
999      return "";
1000    } else {
1001      final int lastIndex = className.lastIndexOf('.');
1002      if (lastIndex < 0) {
1003        return "";
1004      } else if (lastIndex == 0) {
1005        throw new AssertionError("className: " + className);
1006      } else {
1007        return className.substring(0, lastIndex);
1008      }
1009    }
1010  }
1011
1012
1013  /*
1014   * Inner and nested classes.
1015   */
1016
1017
1018  /**
1019   * An element normally {@linkplain Path#iterator() within} a {@link
1020   * Path}, consisting of a {@link #qualifiers() Qualifiers}, a
1021   * {@linkplain #name() name}, and an optional {@linkplain
1022   * #qualified() thing that it designates or points to}.
1023   *
1024   * @param <T> the type of this {@link Element}
1025   *
1026   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1027   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1028   */
1029  public static final class Element<T> implements Qualified<String, Object, T> {
1030
1031
1032    /*
1033     * Static fields.
1034     */
1035
1036
1037    private static final Element<?> ROOT = new Element<>();
1038
1039
1040    /*
1041     * Instance fields.
1042     */
1043
1044
1045    private final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers;
1046
1047    private final T qualified;
1048
1049    private final String name;
1050
1051
1052    /*
1053     * Constructors.
1054     */
1055
1056
1057    // For use by ROOT only.
1058    private Element() {
1059      super();
1060      this.qualifiers = Qualifiers.of();
1061      this.qualified = null;
1062      this.name = "";
1063    }
1064
1065    /**
1066     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1067     *
1068     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; must not be
1069     * {@code null} or {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty}
1070     *
1071     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
1072     *
1073     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code name} {@linkplain
1074     * String#isEmpty() is empty}
1075     *
1076     * @see #Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1077     */
1078    public Element(final String name) {
1079      this(Qualifiers.of(), null, name);
1080    }
1081
1082    /**
1083     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1084     *
1085     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1086     * be {@code null}
1087     *
1088     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1089     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1090     *
1091     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1092     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1093     *
1094     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1095     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1096     * empty}
1097     *
1098     * @see #Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1099     */
1100    public Element(final T qualified, final String name) {
1101      this(Qualifiers.of(), qualified, name);
1102    }
1103
1104    /**
1105     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1106     *
1107     * @param qualifiers the {@link Qualifiers} qualifying this {@link
1108     * Element}; may be {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain
1109     * Qualifiers#of() empty <code>Qualifiers</code>} will be used
1110     * instead
1111     *
1112     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1113     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1114     *
1115     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
1116     *
1117     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code name} {@linkplain
1118     * String#isEmpty() is empty}
1119     *
1120     * @see #Element(Qualifiers, Object, String)
1121     */
1122    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1123    public Element(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, final String name) {
1124      super();
1125      if (name == null) {
1126        throw new NullPointerException("name");
1127      } else if (name.isEmpty()) {
1128        throw new IllegalArgumentException("An empty name may not be paired with a null qualified");
1129      } else {
1130        this.name = name;
1131      }
1132      this.qualifiers = qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty() ? Qualifiers.of() : (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
1133      this.qualified = null;
1134    }
1135
1136    /**
1137     * Creates a new {@link Element}.
1138     *
1139     * @param qualifiers the {@link Qualifiers} qualifying this {@link
1140     * Element}; may be {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain
1141     * Qualifiers#of() empty <code>Qualifiers</code>} will be used
1142     * instead
1143     *
1144     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1145     * be {@code null}
1146     *
1147     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1148     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1149     *
1150     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1151     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1152     *
1153     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1154     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1155     * empty}
1156     */
1157    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1158    public Element(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers, final T qualified, final String name) {
1159      super();
1160      if (qualified == null) {
1161        if (name == null) {
1162          throw new NullPointerException("name");
1163        } else if (name.isEmpty()) {
1164          throw new IllegalArgumentException("An empty name may not be paired with a null qualified");
1165        } else {
1166          this.name = name;
1167        }
1168      } else {
1169        this.name = name == null ? "" : name;
1170      }
1171      this.qualifiers = qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty() ? Qualifiers.of() : (Qualifiers<String, Object>)qualifiers;
1172      this.qualified = qualified;
1173    }
1174
1175
1176    /*
1177     * Instance methods.
1178     */
1179
1180
1181    /**
1182     * Returns an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
1183     * representing this {@link Element}.
1184     *
1185     * @return an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
1186     * representing this {@link Element}; never {@code null}; possibly
1187     * {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty}
1188     *
1189     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1190     *
1191     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1192     *
1193     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1194     * multiple threads.
1195     */
1196    @Override // Constable
1197    public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
1198      if (this.isRoot()) {
1199        return
1200          Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1201                                                  DEFAULT_NAME,
1202                                                  CD_PathElement,
1203                                                  MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
1204                                                                            CD_PathElement,
1205                                                                            "root",
1206                                                                            MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_PathElement))));
1207      } else {
1208        final ConstantDesc qualifiersDesc = this.qualifiers().describeConstable().orElse(null);
1209        if (qualifiersDesc != null) {
1210          final ConstantDesc qualifiedDesc;
1211          final Object qualified = this.qualified();
1212          if (qualified == null) {
1213            qualifiedDesc = NULL;
1214          } else if (qualified instanceof Constable cq) {
1215            qualifiedDesc = cq.describeConstable().orElse(null);
1216          } else if (qualified instanceof ConstantDesc cd) {
1217            qualifiedDesc = cd;
1218          } else {
1219            qualifiedDesc = null;
1220          }
1221          if (qualifiedDesc != null) {
1222            final String name = this.name();
1223            return
1224              Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
1225                                                      name,
1226                                                      CD_PathElement,
1227                                                      MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(CD_PathElement,
1228                                                                                     CD_Qualifiers,
1229                                                                                     CD_Object,
1230                                                                                     CD_String),
1231                                                      qualifiersDesc,
1232                                                      qualifiedDesc,
1233                                                      name));
1234          }
1235        }
1236      }
1237      return Optional.empty();
1238    }
1239
1240    /**
1241     * Returns the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link
1242     * Element}.
1243     *
1244     * @return the {@link Qualifiers} that qualifies this {@link
1245     * Element}
1246     *
1247     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1248     *
1249     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1250     *
1251     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1252     * threads.
1253     */
1254    @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
1255    public final Qualifiers<String, Object> qualifiers() {
1256      return this.qualifiers;
1257    }
1258
1259    /**
1260     * Returns the thing that this {@link Element} describes (which
1261     * may be nothing).
1262     *
1263     * @return the thing that this {@link Element} describes, which
1264     * may be nothing, in which case {@code null} will be returned
1265     *
1266     * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1267     *
1268     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1269     *
1270     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1271     * multiple threads.
1272     */
1273    @Override // Qualified<String, Object, T>
1274    public final T qualified() {
1275      return this.qualified;
1276    }
1277
1278    /**
1279     * Returns the name of this {@link Element}.
1280     *
1281     * @return the name of this {@link Element}
1282     *
1283     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1284     *
1285     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1286     *
1287     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1288     * multiple threads.
1289     */
1290    public final String name() {
1291      return this.name;
1292    }
1293
1294    /**
1295     * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Element} is a <em>root
1296     * element</em>, which is true when the {@link #qualified()}
1297     * method returns {@code null} and the {@link #name()} method
1298     * returns an {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty
1299     * <code>String</code>}.
1300     *
1301     * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Element} is a
1302     * <em>root element</em>
1303     *
1304     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1305     *
1306     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1307     * multiple threads.
1308     */
1309    public final boolean isRoot() {
1310      return this.qualified() == null && this.name().isEmpty();
1311    }
1312
1313    /**
1314     * Returns a {@link Element}, <strong>usually newly
1315     * created</strong>, whose {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}
1316     * have keys that are prefixed with the supplied {@code prefix}.
1317     *
1318     * @param prefix the prefix to apply; may be {@code null} or
1319     * {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty} in which case {@code this}
1320     * will be returned
1321     *
1322     * @return an {@link Element}, <strong>usually newly
1323     * created</strong>, whose {@linkplain #qualifiers() qualifiers}
1324     * have keys that are prefixed with the supplied {@code prefix}
1325     *
1326     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1327     *
1328     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1329     *
1330     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1331     * multiple threads.
1332     */
1333    public final Element<T> withQualifiersPrefix(final String prefix) {
1334      if (prefix == null || prefix.isEmpty()) {
1335        return this;
1336      }
1337      return Element.of(this.qualifiers().withPrefix(k -> prefix + k),
1338                        this.qualified(),
1339                        this.name());
1340    }
1341
1342    /**
1343     * Returns a hashcode for this {@link Element}.
1344     *
1345     * @return a hashcode for this {@link Element}
1346     *
1347     * @idempotency This method is idempotent.
1348     *
1349     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1350     * multiple threads.
1351     */
1352    @Override // Object
1353    public final int hashCode() {
1354      int hashCode = 17;
1355      Object value = this.qualified();
1356      int c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
1357      hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
1358      value = this.name();
1359      c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
1360      hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
1361      value = this.qualifiers();
1362      c = value == null ? 0 : value.hashCode();
1363      hashCode = 37 * hashCode + c;
1364      return hashCode;
1365    }
1366
1367    /**
1368     * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1369     * this {@link Element}.
1370     *
1371     * @param other the {@link Object} to test; may be {@code null} in
1372     * which case {@code false} will be returned
1373     *
1374     * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Object} is equal to
1375     * this {@link Element}; {@code false} otherwise
1376     *
1377     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1378     *
1379     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1380     * multiple threads.
1381     */
1382    @Override // Object
1383    public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
1384      if (this == other) {
1385        return true;
1386      } else if (other != null && this.getClass() == other.getClass()) {
1387        final Element<?> her = (Element<?>)other;
1388        return
1389          Objects.equals(this.qualified(), her.qualified()) &&
1390          Objects.equals(this.name(), her.name()) &&
1391          Objects.equals(this.qualifiers(), her.qualifiers());
1392      } else {
1393        return false;
1394      }
1395    }
1396
1397    /**
1398     * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link String} representation of
1399     * this {@link Element}.
1400     *
1401     * <p>The format of the {@link String} that is returned is
1402     * deliberately unspecified and subject to change without notice
1403     * from version to version of this class.</p>
1404     *
1405     * @return a {@link String} representation of this {@link Element}
1406     *
1407     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}
1408     *
1409     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1410     *
1411     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1412     * multiple threads.
1413     */
1414    @Override // Object
1415    public final String toString() {
1416      final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1417      final T qualified = this.qualified();
1418      if (qualified != null) {
1419        sb.append(qualified).append(':');
1420      }
1421      sb.append(name);
1422      final Map<?, ?> map = this.qualifiers().toMap();
1423      if (!map.isEmpty()) {
1424        sb.append(map);
1425      }
1426      return sb.toString();
1427    }
1428
1429
1430    /*
1431     * Static methods.
1432     */
1433
1434
1435    /**
1436     * Returns a {@link Element} that {@linkplain #isRoot() is a
1437     * <em>root element</em>}.
1438     *
1439     * @return an {@link Element} that {@linkplain #isRoot() is a
1440     * <em>root element</em>}
1441     *
1442     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1443     *
1444     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1445     *
1446     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1447     * multiple threads.
1448     */
1449    public static final Element<?> root() {
1450      return ROOT;
1451    }
1452
1453    /**
1454     * Returns a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments.
1455     *
1456     * <p>The returned {@link Element} may be newly created or it may
1457     * be cached.  No assumption must be made about its identity.</p>
1458     *
1459     * @param <T> the type of this {@link Element}
1460     *
1461     * @param qualifiers the {@link Qualifiers} qualifying this {@link
1462     * Element}; may be {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain
1463     * Qualifiers#of() empty <code>Qualifiers</code>} will be used
1464     * instead
1465     *
1466     * @param qualified the thing this {@link Element} describes; may
1467     * be {@code null}
1468     *
1469     * @param name the name of this {@link Element}; may be {@code
1470     * null} only if {@code qualified} is not {@code null}
1471     *
1472     * @return a {@link Element} representing the supplied arguments
1473     *
1474     * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualified} is {@code
1475     * null} and {@code name} is {@code null}
1476     *
1477     * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code qualified} is
1478     * {@code null} and {@code name} {@linkplain String#isEmpty() is
1479     * empty}
1480     *
1481     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1482     *
1483     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1484     *
1485     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1486     * multiple threads.
1487     */
1488    public static final <T> Element<T> of(final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers,
1489                                          final T qualified,
1490                                          final String name) {
1491      return new Element<>(qualifiers, qualified, name);
1492    }
1493

1515     * empty}

1520     *
1521     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1522     * multiple threads.
1523     */
1524    public static final <T> Element<T> of(final T qualified, final String name) {

1526    }
